--- title: "Mini Text Project" sidebar: false format: html: default editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ## Unifished framework of MP4 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ readr 2.1.5 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 ✔ ggplot2 3.5.0 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.1 ✔ purrr 1.0.2 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(jsonlite) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: package 'jsonlite' was built under R version 4.3.3 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'jsonlite' The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': flatten ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidytext) library(textdata) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: package 'textdata' was built under R version 4.3.3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(wordcloud) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: package 'wordcloud' was built under R version 4.3.3 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Loading required package: RColorBrewer ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggthemes) library(kableExtra) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'kableExtra' The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': group_rows ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data <- read_json("https://github.com/leinstay/steamdb/raw/refs/heads/main/steamdb.json") data2 <- as.data.frame(do.call(rbind, data)) data2 <- data2 |> separate_wider_delim(published_store, delim = "-", names = c("publishedyear", "publishedmonth", "publishedday"), too_few = "debug") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in stri_split_fixed(string, pattern, n = n, simplify = simplify, : argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Debug mode activated: adding variables `published_store_ok`, `published_store_pieces`, and `published_store_remainder`. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in stri_locate_all_fixed(string, pattern, omit_no_match = TRUE, : argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in stri_sub(string, from = start, to = end): argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data2 |> drop_na(publishedyear) |> filter(publishedyear > 2006, publishedyear != "NULL") |> mutate(sequel = str_detect(name, "\\w* \\d\\d?\\b")) |> group_by(publishedyear) |> summarize("Number of Sequels" = sum(sequel), "Total Games" = n(), "Proportion are Sequels" = mean(sequel)) |> print(n=100) |> kable(digits=3) |> kable_styling(bootstrap_options = "striped", full_width = FALSE, position = "float_right") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 16 × 4 publishedyear `Number of Sequels` `Total Games` `Proportion are Sequels` 1 2007 17 106 0.160 2 2008 25 167 0.150 3 2009 52 332 0.157 4 2010 36 280 0.129 5 2011 35 281 0.125 6 2012 45 342 0.132 7 2013 57 475 0.12 8 2014 167 1589 0.105 9 2015 177 2635 0.0672 10 2016 243 4312 0.0564 11 2017 350 6232 0.0562 12 2018 395 8169 0.0484 13 2019 428 8014 0.0534 14 2020 511 9636 0.0530 15 2021 433 7886 0.0549 16 2022 183 3283 0.0557 ``` ::: ::: ````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} data2 |> select(name, full_price, meta_score) |> mutate(words_in_name = str_count(name,"\\b[^ ]+\\b"), full_price = str_replace(full_price, "NULL", "0"), full_price = as.numeric(full_price), full_price = full_price/100) |> filter(full_price < 300) |> ggplot(aes(x = words_in_name, y = full_price)) + geom_point(alpha = .1) + geom_smooth(method = lm) + theme_clean() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`. ℹ In argument: `full_price = str_replace(full_price, "NULL", "0")`. Caused by warning in `stri_replace_first_regex()`: ! argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](MiniTextProject_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} pricedata <- data2 |> select(name, full_price) |> mutate(words_in_name = str_count(name,"\\b[^ ]+\\b"), full_price = str_replace(full_price, "NULL", "0"), full_price = as.numeric(full_price), full_price = full_price/100) |> filter(full_price < 300) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`. ℹ In argument: `full_price = str_replace(full_price, "NULL", "0")`. Caused by warning in `stri_replace_first_regex()`: ! argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} summary(lm(full_price ~ words_in_name, data = pricedata)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: lm(formula = full_price ~ words_in_name, data = pricedata) Residuals: Min 1Q Median 3Q Max -18.297 -5.947 -2.350 2.650 193.247 Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 6.14548 0.07965 77.16 <2e-16 *** words_in_name 0.59732 0.02408 24.80 <2e-16 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 Residual standard error: 9.435 on 53977 degrees of freedom Multiple R-squared: 0.01127, Adjusted R-squared: 0.01125 F-statistic: 615.2 on 1 and 53977 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} data2 |> select(languages, publishedyear, full_price) |> mutate(num_commas = str_count(languages,","), num_languages = num_commas + 1, publishedyear = as.numeric(publishedyear), full_price = str_replace(full_price, "NULL", "0"), full_price = as.numeric(full_price), full_price = full_price/100) |> filter(full_price == 59.99) |> group_by(publishedyear) |> summarize(avg_language = mean(num_languages)) |> filter(publishedyear > 2006) |> kable(digits = 1) |> kable_styling(bootstrap_options = "striped", full_width = FALSE, position = "float_right") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There were 3 warnings in `mutate()`. The first warning was: ℹ In argument: `num_commas = str_count(languages, ",")`. Caused by warning in `stri_count_regex()`: ! argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
publishedyear avg_language
2012 5.0
2013 9.0
2014 3.2
2015 3.8
2016 7.8
2017 6.7
2018 8.4
2019 8.4
2020 8.3
2021 8.3
2022 11.5
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} data2 |> mutate(words_in_name = str_count(name,"\\b[^ ]+\\b"), num_commas = str_count(languages,","), num_languages = num_commas + 1, publishedyear = as.numeric(publishedyear), full_price = str_replace(full_price, "NULL", "0"), full_price = as.numeric(full_price), full_price = full_price/100) |> group_by(publishedyear) |> summarize(avg_words = mean(words_in_name)) |> filter(publishedyear > 2006) |> kable(digits = 1) |> kable_styling(bootstrap_options = "striped", full_width = FALSE, position = "float_right") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There were 3 warnings in `mutate()`. The first warning was: ℹ In argument: `num_commas = str_count(languages, ",")`. Caused by warning in `stri_count_regex()`: ! argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
publishedyear avg_words
2007 3.8
2008 3.7
2009 3.7
2010 3.4
2011 3.2
2012 3.2
2013 3.2
2014 3.2
2015 3.0
2016 2.9
2017 2.9
2018 2.8
2019 2.8
2020 2.8
2021 2.8
2022 2.8
````` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #the json data waas very broken, not sure if these count as strings and regular expressions for my 3, but basically i'm just tricking r into turning into proper text descriptions <- data2 |> mutate(names = str_extract(name, ".*"), descriptions = str_extract(description, ".*")) |> select(descriptions, names, publishedyear) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`. ℹ In argument: `descriptions = str_extract(description, ".*")`. Caused by warning in `stri_extract_first_regex()`: ! argument is not an atomic vector; coercing ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tidy_descriptions <- descriptions |> mutate(line = row_number()) |> unnest_tokens(word, descriptions, token = "words") smart_stopwords <- get_stopwords(source = "smart") font_stopwords <- tibble( word = c("br","li","strong","ul","quot", "game"), lexicon = "font") #top 20 words of all times tidy_descriptions |> filter(publishedyear != "NULL") |> anti_join(smart_stopwords) |> anti_join(font_stopwords) |> count(word, sort = TRUE) |> filter(word != "NA") |> slice_max(n, n = 20) |> ggplot(aes(fct_reorder(word, n), n)) + geom_col() + coord_flip() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Joining with `by = join_by(word)` Joining with `by = join_by(word)` ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](MiniTextProject_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #top 10 word for each year (I tried so hard to order them for each year but it doesn't work ) tidy_descriptions |> filter(publishedyear != "NULL", publishedyear > 2006) |> anti_join(smart_stopwords) |> anti_join(font_stopwords) |> group_by(publishedyear, word) |> summarize(n =n()) |> arrange(publishedyear, desc(n)) |> slice_max(n, n = 10) |> ggplot(aes(fct_reorder(word, n), n, fill = publishedyear)) + geom_col() + coord_flip() + facet_wrap(~ publishedyear, scales = "free") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Joining with `by = join_by(word)` Joining with `by = join_by(word)` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'publishedyear'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](MiniTextProject_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} words <- tidy_descriptions |> anti_join(stop_words) |> anti_join(font_stopwords) |> count(word) |> filter(word != "NA") |> arrange(desc(n)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Joining with `by = join_by(word)` Joining with `by = join_by(word)` ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # word cloud of all years wordcloud( words = words$word, freq = words$n, max.words = 200, random.order = FALSE, rot.per = 0.35, scale = c(3.5, 0.25), colors = brewer.pal(9, "Dark2")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in brewer.pal(9, "Dark2"): n too large, allowed maximum for palette Dark2 is 8 Returning the palette you asked for with that many colors ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](MiniTextProject_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
